text:
Miss Eleanor Wensberg
Page 2
May 25, 1956
In addition. Active members with radio stations may use the facilities
of the NAEB Radio Network upon payment of an annual assessment fee*
Tlie Network distributes approximately eight hours of programming, by
tape recording, weekly, to members subscribing to its service. This
fee is also based on power (with the same power classifications as mem¬
bership) and a new station does not have to pay the full fee until the
third year it is in the Network. The fees are:
1st year
WJE7KT
250.00
150.00
2nd year
maim"
375.00
225.00
3rd year
TOT
5oo.oo
300.00
Class A
Class B
Class C
Stations must also pay postage both ways on the tapes shipped to and
from Network Headquarters here in Urbana, Illinois. Still even a
Class A station paying its full third-year rate is paying only a lit¬
tle over $2.00 an hour for better than U00 hours of programming from
the Network in a year. This is about the most inexpensive programming
a station can do.
If, after looking over the materials which we shall send you, you have
further questions, we shall be most happy to answer them.
Sincerely,
Harold E. Hill
Associate Director
HEHrcr
